poem:
Title: "Blinken's Balancing Act"

Unwanted tune of a sad Middle East song,
Blinken's dance keeps the time, but feels wrong,
Civilians' sighs echo a toll too high,
And genocide's word, a distracting lie?
Ground shakes again, with hurt so deep, 
In Gaza's keep, children weep.
Pains carved on a blood-stained calendar,
Plight of the innocent, no longer a slander.
